clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Effectiveness of 2 Manual Therapies Administered by Osteopaths on Functional Outcome in Sub-acute and Chronic Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Effectiveness of 2 Manual Therapies Administered by Osteopaths on Functional Outcome in Sub-acute and Chronic Low Back Pain Less Than 1 Year Duration: a Randomised Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France
Institut Universitaire Romand de Sante au Travail

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a standardised osteopathic manipulative treatment is more effective on 3 months functional recovery than a placebo of osteopathic manipulative treatment, in sub-acute and chronic low back pain less than 1 year duration.

detailed_description.textblock: Sub-acute (4-12 weeks duration) and chronic (more than 3 months duration) low back pain (LBP) is frequent, disabling and costly. The effectiveness of usual treatments (including pain killers, anti-inflammatory drugs, spinal infiltrations, physiotherapy, spinal traction, transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation, etc) may be not sufficient, and many patients resort to alternative therapies. Manipulative treatments represent en emerging therapy in this area, although studies assessing their effectiveness are limited and often biased. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of two manual therapies administered by osteopaths on improving functional recovery in sub-acute and chronic low back pain less than 1 year. A standardised osteopathic manipulative treatment is compare to a placebo of osteopathic manipulative treatment.

clinical_study.condition: Sub-acute and Chronic Low Back Pain

arm_group.description: 6 sessions of standardized placebo of manipulative treatment

intervention.description: A standardized manipulative treatment according to the results of a physical examination including 7 anatomical areas will be given by trained osteopaths during 6 sessions (with an interval of 2 weeks between 2 sessions). Each session will last 45 minutes. Osteopaths will have 3 days of training in standardized manipulative treatment.

A standardized placebo of manipulative treatment consisting in "light touch" and according to the results of a physical examination including 7 anatomical areas will be given by trained osteopaths during 6 sessions (with an interval of 2 weeks between 2 sessions). Each session will last 45 minutes. Osteopaths will have 3 days of training in standardized placebo of manipulative treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient consulting for back pain
- Male or female aged from 18 to 65 years (included)
- Sub-acute or chronic low back pain less than 1 year duration (for the current episode)
- Patient can speak and understand French
- Patient giving his informed consent to participate in the study
- Patient affiliated to or beneficiary of social insurance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Back pain caused by: inflammatory, tumoral, infectious disease or a back traumatism in the 3 past months
- Back surgery and/or fracture in the 6 past months
- Presence of a motor impairment related to the reason for consultation
- Chronic low back pain more than 1 year duration (for the current episode)
- The patient is a student or a practitioner in manipulative therapies
- Pregnancy
- Inability to understand the process of the study
- The patient is already included in another clinical study
